TrainRateMethod trainRateMethod
 Variable containing the actual method used to obtain a suitable train rate.

Detailed Description

This concrete class represents the gradient descent training algorithm for an objective functional of a multilayer perceptron.

See also:
TrainingAlgorithm.

Definition at line 31 of file GradientDescent.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Flood::GradientDescent::TrainRateMethod

Available training operators for obtaining the train rate.

Enumerator:
Fixed 
GoldenSection 
BrentMethod 

Definition at line 40 of file GradientDescent.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Flood::GradientDescent::GradientDescent ( ObjectiveFunctional *  newObjectiveFunctional  ) 

General constructor. It creates a gradient descent training algorithm object associated to an objective functional object. It also initializes the class members to their default values:

Training operators:

  • Train rate method = Brent;

Training parameters:

  • First train rate: 1.0.
  • Bracketing factor: 2.0.
  • Tolerance in train rate: 1.0e-3.

Stopping criteria:

  • Evaluation goal: -1.0e99.
  • Gradient norm goal: 0.0.
  • Maximum training time: 1.0e6.
  • Maximum number of epochs: 100.

User stuff:

  • Warning train rate: 1.0e6.
  • Error train rate: 1.0e12.
  • Display: true.
  • Display period: 25.

Parameters:
newObjectiveFunctional Pointer to an objective functional object.
See also:
TrainingAlgorithm.

Definition at line 67 of file GradientDescent.cpp.

References bracketingFactor, BrentMethod, Flood::TrainingAlgorithm::displayPeriod, errorTrainRate, Flood::TrainingAlgorithm::evaluationGoal, firstTrainRate, Flood::TrainingAlgorithm::gradientNormGoal, Flood::TrainingAlgorithm::maximumNumberOfEpochs, Flood::TrainingAlgorithm::maximumTime, reserveTrainingDirectionHistory, reserveTrainingDirectionNormHistory, reserveTrainingRateHistory, trainRateMethod, trainRateTolerance, and warningTrainRate.

Flood::GradientDescent::GradientDescent ( void   ) 

Default constructor. It creates a gradient descent training algorithm object not associated to any objective functional object. It also initializes the class members to their default values:

Training operators:

  • Train rate method = Brent;

Training parameters:

  • First train rate: 1.0.
  • Bracketing factor: 2.0.
  • Tolerance in train rate: 1.0e-3.

Stopping criteria:

  • Evaluation goal: -1.0e99.
  • Gradient norm goal: 0.0.
  • Maximum training time: 1.0e6.
  • Maximum number of epochs: 100.

User stuff:

  • Warning train rate: 1.0e6.
  • Error train rate: 1.0e12.
  • Display: true.
  • Display period: 25.

See also:
TrainingAlgorithm.

Member Function Documentation

double Flood::GradientDescent::calculateGoldenSectionTrainRate ( double  initialTrainRate,
double  evaluation,
Vector< double >  freeParameters,
Vector< double >  trainDirection 
) [private]

This method returns the train rate by searching in a given direction to locate the minimum of the objective function in that direction. It uses the golden section method.

Parameters:
initialTrainRate Initial train rate in line minimization.
evaluation Network's evaluation value.
freeParameters Network's free parameters vector.
trainDirection Train direction vector.
See also:
calculateBrentMethodTrainRate(double, double, Vector<double>, Vector<double>).

train(void).

double  evaluation,
Vector< double >  freeParameters,
Vector< double >  trainDirection 
) [private]

This method returns the train rate by searching in a given direction to locate the minimum of the evaluation function in that direction. It uses the Brent's method.

void Flood::GradientDescent::setTrainingDirectionHistory ( Matrix< double >  newTrainingDirectionHistory  ) 

This method sets a new matrix containing the training direction history over the training epochs. Each row in the matrix contains the training direction vector of one single epoch.

Parameters:
newTrainingDirectionHistory Training direction history matrix.

void Flood::GradientDescent::train ( void   )  [virtual]

This method trains a multilayer perceptron with an associated objective functional according to the gradient descent algorithm. Training occurs according to the training parameters.

See also:
TrainRateMethod.

void Flood::GradientDescent::print ( void   )  [virtual]

This method prints to the screen the training parameters, the stopping criteria and other user stuff concerning the gradient descent object:

Training operators:

  • Train rate method.

Training parameters:

  • Initial train rate.
  • Train rate tolerance.

Stopping criteria:

  • Evaluation goal.
  • Gradient norm goal.
  • Maximum time.
  • Maximum number of epochs.

User stuff:

  • Warning train rate.
  • Error train rate.
  • Display.
  • Display period.
  • Reserve elapsed time history.
  • Reserve free parameters history.
  • Reserve free parameters norm history.
  • Reserve evaluation history.
  • Reserve gradient history.
  • Reserve gradient norm history.
  • Reserve training direction history.
  • Reserve training direction norm history.
  • Reserve training rate history.
